results.title: He’s the Bad Boy of Chess. But Did He Cheat?
results.abstract: An American teenager, Hans Niemann, defeated Magnus Carlsen, the world’s best chess player. Then Mr. Carlsen accused his opponent of cheating. It’s either overdue justice or paranoia.

results.title: Long-Simmering Lamb for Waning Fall Days
results.abstract: Braised shanks, a carrot salad and a molasses ginger cake: This cozy menu from David Tanis, drawing from North Africa, is sure to warm.

media.caption: After three hours in the pot, the lamb is fragrant and tender.
media.copyright: David Malosh for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Simon Andrews.

results.title: Mutual Funds That Consistently Beat the Market? Not One of 2,132.
results.abstract: No actively managed stock or bond funds outperformed the market convincingly and regularly over the last five years. Index funds have generally been better.

results.abstract: Poet, essayist, journalist and social critic, he held wide influence among a postwar literary generation with works as intellectual as they were political.
